Q570: The egg is carried from the ovary to the womb through:

Source: RRB ALP & Tec. (17-08-18 Shift-III)
Correct! As a result of ovulation from the graafian follicle of the ovary, the oocytes into the fallopian tube. The wave motion of the fallopian tube wall and the cilia of mucosa pull oocytes down into the tube. In human (woman), the process of fertilization occurs in the upper 1/3 part of the ovarian duct.
Incorrect. As a result of ovulation from the graafian follicle of the ovary, the oocytes into the fallopian tube. The wave motion of the fallopian tube wall and the cilia of mucosa pull oocytes down into the tube. In human (woman), the process of fertilization occurs in the upper 1/3 part of the ovarian duct.

Q571: Name the organ where the embryo develops:

Source: RRB ALP & Tec. (21-08-18 Shift-II)
Correct! The organ, where the embryo develops is called the uterus. The uterus is an organ of the female reproductive system, which is responsible for many reproductive functions including menstruation, conception and delivery etc. The uterus, also commonly known as the womb, is a hollow muscular organ of the female reproductive system that is responsible for the development of the embryo and fetus during pregnancy. RRB Science Planner Biology YCT 588
Incorrect. The organ, where the embryo develops is called the uterus. The uterus is an organ of the female reproductive system, which is responsible for many reproductive functions including menstruation, conception and delivery etc. The uterus, also commonly known as the womb, is a hollow muscular organ of the female reproductive system that is responsible for the development of the embryo and fetus during pregnancy. RRB Science Planner Biology YCT 588

Q572: Testis are located outside the abdominal cavity in the ……….. .

Source: RRB ALP & Tec. (29-08-18 Shift-I)
Correct! The testes are located outside of the abdominal cavity in the scrotum. The testes are also called reproductive glands of the male, they produce sperm. Sperm formation requires a lower temperature than the normal body temperature that is why testes are located in scrotum outside the abdominal cavity, while the temperature in the abdominal cavity is relatively high.
Incorrect. The testes are located outside of the abdominal cavity in the scrotum. The testes are also called reproductive glands of the male, they produce sperm. Sperm formation requires a lower temperature than the normal body temperature that is why testes are located in scrotum outside the abdominal cavity, while the temperature in the abdominal cavity is relatively high.

Q573: Fertilization results in the formation of a/an :

Source: RRB ALP & Tec. (30-08-18 Shift-III)
Correct! Fertilization results in the formation of a zygote. Fertilization is the process in which haploid gametes fuse to form a diploid cell called a zygote. Fertilization is the process of formation of zygotes by insertion of male gametes (sperm) and female gametes (ovum). Internal fertilization occurs in human. In human, fertilization takes place in fallopian tube of the female.
Incorrect. Fertilization results in the formation of a zygote. Fertilization is the process in which haploid gametes fuse to form a diploid cell called a zygote. Fertilization is the process of formation of zygotes by insertion of male gametes (sperm) and female gametes (ovum). Internal fertilization occurs in human. In human, fertilization takes place in fallopian tube of the female.

Q574: Which of the following is a reproductive cell?

Source: RRB JE 26.05.2019 (Shift-III)
Correct! The gamete is a reproductive cell.
Incorrect. The gamete is a reproductive cell.

Q575: What marks the onset of puberty in females?

Source: RRB ALP & Tec. (31-08-18 Shift-III)
Correct! The reproductive cycle in the female primates (monkey, apes and human) is called menstrual cycle or menstruation. Menarche defines the onset of menstruation, which is a normal physiological process that occurs at regular monthly intervals in females. This menstrual cycle is repeated after a period of 28/29 days. That is why, the regular interval from one menstrual cycle to another is called menstrual cycle. Ovulation typically happens around day 14 i.e mid of a 28-day menstrual cycle.
Incorrect. The reproductive cycle in the female primates (monkey, apes and human) is called menstrual cycle or menstruation. Menarche defines the onset of menstruation, which is a normal physiological process that occurs at regular monthly intervals in females. This menstrual cycle is repeated after a period of 28/29 days. That is why, the regular interval from one menstrual cycle to another is called menstrual cycle. Ovulation typically happens around day 14 i.e mid of a 28-day menstrual cycle.

Q576: What is the process of production of ovum in females called ?

Source: RRB ALP & Tec. (31-08-18 Shift-II)
Correct! The process of production of ovum in females is called oogenesis. In females, the process of fertilization occurs in the fallopian tube. The haploid male sperm gets fuse with the haploid female ovum in fallopian tube and form a diploid structure called the zygote. It contains half of the genes of male and female parent.
Incorrect. The process of production of ovum in females is called oogenesis. In females, the process of fertilization occurs in the fallopian tube. The haploid male sperm gets fuse with the haploid female ovum in fallopian tube and form a diploid structure called the zygote. It contains half of the genes of male and female parent.

Q577: A newborn baby is fed with the first secretion called colostrum from the mammary gland.What does colostrum impart?

Source: RRB NTPC Stage Ist 26.04.2016 (Shift-II)
Correct! The first secretion from the mammary gland of a human that fed to newborn, is called colostrum. Colostrum imparts immunity. Colostrum is a form of milk produced by the mammals. Colostrum contains various types of proteins, carbohydrates, fats, minerals and antibodies.
Incorrect. The first secretion from the mammary gland of a human that fed to newborn, is called colostrum. Colostrum imparts immunity. Colostrum is a form of milk produced by the mammals. Colostrum contains various types of proteins, carbohydrates, fats, minerals and antibodies.

Q578: Birth control pills contain :

Source: RRB NTPC 11.04.2016 (Shift-I) Stage Ist
Correct! Birth control pills contain mixture of progesterone and estrogen derivatives. The birth control pills are the derivatives of estrogen and progesterone. These pills are still the safest and recognized worldwide for unwanted pregnancy and family planning.Estrogen and progesterone are the female hormones that are associated with ovulation and menstruation in females while Testosterone is a hormone that is responsible for many of the physical characteristics specific to adult males.
Incorrect. Birth control pills contain mixture of progesterone and estrogen derivatives. The birth control pills are the derivatives of estrogen and progesterone. These pills are still the safest and recognized worldwide for unwanted pregnancy and family planning.Estrogen and progesterone are the female hormones that are associated with ovulation and menstruation in females while Testosterone is a hormone that is responsible for many of the physical characteristics specific to adult males.

Q579: Being started maturation of reproductive tissues, body growth generally decreases. This state of adolescence is called –––––––.

Source: RRB Group-D 15-10-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! When the body undergoes changes, leading to reproductive maturity, generally body growth decreases. This state of adolescence is called puberty. Puberty is a period of psychosocial and social changes between adolescence and adulthood.
Incorrect. When the body undergoes changes, leading to reproductive maturity, generally body growth decreases. This state of adolescence is called puberty. Puberty is a period of psychosocial and social changes between adolescence and adulthood.

Q580: The tissue that provides nourishment to the embryo in the uterus is-

Source: RRB Group-D 22-09-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! Placenta is the tissue that provides nutrition to the embryo in the uterus. It acts as an intermediary between the infant and the mother.
Incorrect. Placenta is the tissue that provides nutrition to the embryo in the uterus. It acts as an intermediary between the infant and the mother.

Q581: ––––– is the name of the age during which the reproductive organs of human males and females become functional, the gonads start producing gametes and sex hormones, and become mature towards human sex.

Source: RRB Group-D 12-10-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! Adolescence is the name of the age during which the reproductive organs of human males and females become functional, the gonads start producing gametes and sex hormones, and become sexually mature . The period of life, when the body undergoes changes, leading to reproductive maturity, is called adolescence. Adolescence begins around the age of 11 and lasts upto 18 or 19 years of age. RRB Science Planner Biology YCT 589
Incorrect. Adolescence is the name of the age during which the reproductive organs of human males and females become functional, the gonads start producing gametes and sex hormones, and become sexually mature . The period of life, when the body undergoes changes, leading to reproductive maturity, is called adolescence. Adolescence begins around the age of 11 and lasts upto 18 or 19 years of age. RRB Science Planner Biology YCT 589

Q582: Which process of fusion sperm and ova results in the formation of a single structure called zygote?

Source: RRB Group-D 04-10-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! Fertilization is the process of fusion sperm and ova results in the formation of a single structure called zygote. The gamete is an eukaryotic type germ cell which is formed as a result of mitosis cell division in the process of gametes production. The reproductive cell of males is called sperm and the reproductive cell of females is called as ova.
Incorrect. Fertilization is the process of fusion sperm and ova results in the formation of a single structure called zygote. The gamete is an eukaryotic type germ cell which is formed as a result of mitosis cell division in the process of gametes production. The reproductive cell of males is called sperm and the reproductive cell of females is called as ova.

Q583: Sperms are produced in ––––.

Source: RRB Group-D 27-09-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! The organs producing the reproductive cells and carrying them to the place of fertilization, collectively form the male reproductive system. Sperm are produced in the testis. They are located in the testicles within a system of tiny tubes called the seminiferous tubules, outside the abdominal cavity. The reason for this is that the heat required for sperm formation is less than the body temperature, so they are found outside the body.
Incorrect. The organs producing the reproductive cells and carrying them to the place of fertilization, collectively form the male reproductive system. Sperm are produced in the testis. They are located in the testicles within a system of tiny tubes called the seminiferous tubules, outside the abdominal cavity. The reason for this is that the heat required for sperm formation is less than the body temperature, so they are found outside the body.

Q584: Why do men have testicles outside the body?

Source: RRB Group-D 24-10-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! The testes — also called testicles — are two oval-shaped organs in the male reproductive system. They're contained in a sac of skin called the scrotum. The scrotum hangs outside the body in the front of the pelvic region near the upper thighs. Sperm formation requires a lower temperature than normal body temperature,this is why men have testicles outside the body. Each testis is an oval-shaped structure wrapped in a double layer of peritoneum known as the tunica vaginalis. The testicular tissue consists of numerous blind-ending tubules known as seminiferous tubules. Interstitial cells are found between the seminiferous tubules, which secrete hormones called testosterone.
Incorrect. The testes — also called testicles — are two oval-shaped organs in the male reproductive system. They're contained in a sac of skin called the scrotum. The scrotum hangs outside the body in the front of the pelvic region near the upper thighs. Sperm formation requires a lower temperature than normal body temperature,this is why men have testicles outside the body. Each testis is an oval-shaped structure wrapped in a double layer of peritoneum known as the tunica vaginalis. The testicular tissue consists of numerous blind-ending tubules known as seminiferous tubules. Interstitial cells are found between the seminiferous tubules, which secrete hormones called testosterone.

Q585: ........ serves as a nutritive tissue for growing embryo.

Source: RRB Group-D 12-11-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! Endosperm serves as nutritive tissue for growing embryos. Embryonic development is called embryogenesis. This embryonic stage lasts until the end of eight weeks.
Incorrect. Endosperm serves as nutritive tissue for growing embryos. Embryonic development is called embryogenesis. This embryonic stage lasts until the end of eight weeks.

Q586: Name the tube that originates from male testis and carries sperm into the body?

Source: RRB Group-D 23-10-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! Vas deferens is the tube that originates from the male testis and carries the sperm into the body. The vas deferens transports mature sperm to the urethra in preparation for ejaculation.
Incorrect. Vas deferens is the tube that originates from the male testis and carries the sperm into the body. The vas deferens transports mature sperm to the urethra in preparation for ejaculation.

Q587: Sperms are temporarily stored in the ……… .

Source: RRB Group-D 04-12-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! In mammals, sperm cells are produced in the seminiferous tubules of each testis. These sperm cells leave the testes and pass into a larger coiled tube known as the epididymis. The sperm cells attain maturity in the epididymis. The sperm cells are stored in this structure till they are ejaculated. Here, they live for about 30 days. During ejaculation, the sperms pass from the epididymis into the vas deferens and are ejaculated with the semen through the penis.
Incorrect. In mammals, sperm cells are produced in the seminiferous tubules of each testis. These sperm cells leave the testes and pass into a larger coiled tube known as the epididymis. The sperm cells attain maturity in the epididymis. The sperm cells are stored in this structure till they are ejaculated. Here, they live for about 30 days. During ejaculation, the sperms pass from the epididymis into the vas deferens and are ejaculated with the semen through the penis.

Q588: Which of the following is a male reproductive part in human beings?

Source: RRB Group-D 22-09-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! The process by which organisms increase their numbers is called reproduction. The organs that participate in the reproduction of organisms are called reproductive organs. (Reproductive Organ) (Male) (Female) -Testes and Scrotal sac - Ovaries -Vas deferens - Fallopian Tube -Seminal Vesicles - Uterus -Penis - Vagina
Incorrect. The process by which organisms increase their numbers is called reproduction. The organs that participate in the reproduction of organisms are called reproductive organs. (Reproductive Organ) (Male) (Female) -Testes and Scrotal sac - Ovaries -Vas deferens - Fallopian Tube -Seminal Vesicles - Uterus -Penis - Vagina

Q589: The child is born as a result of rhythmic contraction of muscles in ....

Source: RRB Group-D 28-09-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! The main function of the uterus is to provide space for its development until the fertilized egg is converted into a embryo. Along with, the baby is born as a result of rhythmic contractions in the uterine muscles.
Incorrect. The main function of the uterus is to provide space for its development until the fertilized egg is converted into a embryo. Along with, the baby is born as a result of rhythmic contractions in the uterine muscles.

Q590: Uterus opens into the vagina through:

Source: RRB Group-D 31-10-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! The uterus is a hollow, pear-shaped organ in a woman's lower stomach between the bladder and the rectum.The cervix is the lower part of the uterus that opens into the vagina. The vagina is a tube that connects the uterus to the outside of the body.
Incorrect. The uterus is a hollow, pear-shaped organ in a woman's lower stomach between the bladder and the rectum.The cervix is the lower part of the uterus that opens into the vagina. The vagina is a tube that connects the uterus to the outside of the body.

Q591: Female germ cells or eggs are made in the:

Source: RRB Group-D 15-10-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! Female germ cells form in the ovaries. Female reproductive hormones also produce estrogen and progesterone. These cells are found in the immature state of the ovaries from the time of birth of the girl, which begin to mature as soon as puberty begins.
Incorrect. Female germ cells form in the ovaries. Female reproductive hormones also produce estrogen and progesterone. These cells are found in the immature state of the ovaries from the time of birth of the girl, which begin to mature as soon as puberty begins.

Q592: The cavity of the graafian follicle is called

Source: RRB Group-D 27-11-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! The cavity of the graafian follicle is called antrum. Graafian follicle is marked by the formation of a fluid-filled cavity adjacent to the oocyte, called the antrum.
Incorrect. The cavity of the graafian follicle is called antrum. Graafian follicle is marked by the formation of a fluid-filled cavity adjacent to the oocyte, called the antrum.

Q593: The germ cells that store food for the fetus are called ………….

Source: RRB Group-D 20-09-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! The initial stage of organism development is called embryo. The embryo receives its nutrition in the early stages from the nutritive substances brought by oocytes.
Incorrect. The initial stage of organism development is called embryo. The embryo receives its nutrition in the early stages from the nutritive substances brought by oocytes.

Q594: …………… carries sperms out of the testes.

Source: RRB Group-D 27-11-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! The sperms are carried out of the testes through vas deferens. The name of the male genital organ in a human is testes and it is located in the testicles. Its function is to produce sperm, secretes a hormone called testosterone and nourishes it.
Incorrect. The sperms are carried out of the testes through vas deferens. The name of the male genital organ in a human is testes and it is located in the testicles. Its function is to produce sperm, secretes a hormone called testosterone and nourishes it.

Q595: Which of the following is not a male reproductive organ?

Source: RRB Group-D 07-12-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! The male reproductive organ is located in the pelvic region of the body. Male reproductive organs are included prostate gland , vas deferens,seminal vesicles, epididymis, scrotum, etc. while female reproductive components are cervix , ovary , uterus etc.
Incorrect. The male reproductive organ is located in the pelvic region of the body. Male reproductive organs are included prostate gland , vas deferens,seminal vesicles, epididymis, scrotum, etc. while female reproductive components are cervix , ovary , uterus etc.

Q596: The vas deferens joins a tube coming from the bladder to form a comman passage, called the ––––––––––.

Source: RRB Group-D 12-12-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! The vas deferens joins a tube coming from the bladder to form a common passage, called the urethra.
Incorrect. The vas deferens joins a tube coming from the bladder to form a common passage, called the urethra.

Q597: The embryo receives nutrition from the mother's blood with the help of a special cord, is called ………

Correct! The embryo gets nourishment inside the mother body through a special tissue called placenta. The embryo grows inside the mother's womb and gets nourishment from mother's blood through the tissue called placenta. The placenta is a temporary organ that develops in the uterus during pregnancy. It attaches the fetus to the uterine wall. It also provides nutrients to the fetus and also allows the fetus to transfer waste products to the mother's blood.
Incorrect. The embryo gets nourishment inside the mother body through a special tissue called placenta. The embryo grows inside the mother's womb and gets nourishment from mother's blood through the tissue called placenta. The placenta is a temporary organ that develops in the uterus during pregnancy. It attaches the fetus to the uterine wall. It also provides nutrients to the fetus and also allows the fetus to transfer waste products to the mother's blood.

Q598: The egg is carried from the ovary to the womb through the:

Source: RRB Group-D 26-10-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! The egg is carried from the ovary to the womb by the oviduct. The fallopian tube is the tubular part of the female reproductive organ, located on both sides of the uterus. They carry the eggs, i.e. it is the passageway for the eggs to reach the uterus.
Incorrect. The egg is carried from the ovary to the womb by the oviduct. The fallopian tube is the tubular part of the female reproductive organ, located on both sides of the uterus. They carry the eggs, i.e. it is the passageway for the eggs to reach the uterus.

Q599: Which of the following is not a part of the female reproductive system?

Source: RRB Group-D 26-10-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! Vas deferens is not a female but a male reproductive organ. The sperms are carried by vas deferens into the seminal vesicles. The sperm migrate from the seminiferous tubules to the epididymis.
Incorrect. Vas deferens is not a female but a male reproductive organ. The sperms are carried by vas deferens into the seminal vesicles. The sperm migrate from the seminiferous tubules to the epididymis.

Q600: Which human body part carry eggs from ovary to uterus?

Source: RRB Group-D 24-10-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! The sperm and the ovum together form embryo in the fallopian tube, that is the first stage of pregnancy. The uterine tubes, also known as oviducts or fallopian tubes, are the female structures that transport the ova from the ovary to the uterus each month. In the presence of sperm and fertilization, the uterine tubes transport the fertilized egg to the uterus for implantation.
Incorrect. The sperm and the ovum together form embryo in the fallopian tube, that is the first stage of pregnancy. The uterine tubes, also known as oviducts or fallopian tubes, are the female structures that transport the ova from the ovary to the uterus each month. In the presence of sperm and fertilization, the uterine tubes transport the fertilized egg to the uterus for implantation.

Q601: What is the method in which Copper-T is placed in the uterus called?

Source: RRB Group-D 24-10-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! Copper-T is used for contraception. It is placed into the uterus of women. Once copper-T is properly implanted, it acts as a barrier between the zygote and the uterine walls, preventing the woman from conceiving. RRB Science Planner Biology YCT 591
Incorrect. Copper-T is used for contraception. It is placed into the uterus of women. Once copper-T is properly implanted, it acts as a barrier between the zygote and the uterine walls, preventing the woman from conceiving. RRB Science Planner Biology YCT 591

Q602: In which part of the male reproductive system is the main genetic material found?

Source: RRB Group-D 22-10-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! In human beings,the main genetic material is found in the sperm of the male reproductive system. Sperm or sperm cells are male reproductive cells whose main function is to form the zygote by fusion with the female reproductive cells.
Incorrect. In human beings,the main genetic material is found in the sperm of the male reproductive system. Sperm or sperm cells are male reproductive cells whose main function is to form the zygote by fusion with the female reproductive cells.

Q603: Labor pain is caused due to contractions in walls of ………. .

Source: RRB Group-D 27-09-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! Labor pain is caused due to contractions in the walls of the uterus. Pain during labor is caused by contractions of the muscles of the uterus and by pressure on the cervix.
Incorrect. Labor pain is caused due to contractions in the walls of the uterus. Pain during labor is caused by contractions of the muscles of the uterus and by pressure on the cervix.

Q604: In the development of the child (in the case of humans) takes months approx ………… inside the mother's body.

Source: RRB Group-D 25-09-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! Generally, period of 9 months from the date of conception is suitable for the development of the child, but this period may increase or decrease in exceptional circumstances.
Incorrect. Generally, period of 9 months from the date of conception is suitable for the development of the child, but this period may increase or decrease in exceptional circumstances.

Q605: ………..results in the formation of zygote.

Source: RRB Group-D 24-09-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! The cell that forms by two gamete cells through sexual reproduction, are called zygote. This fusion of germ cells is known as fertilization. The zygote is formed by fertilization of sperm and ovum.
Incorrect. The cell that forms by two gamete cells through sexual reproduction, are called zygote. This fusion of germ cells is known as fertilization. The zygote is formed by fertilization of sperm and ovum.

Q606: In humans, the fertilized egg is implanted into the lining of ……….

Source: RRB Group-D 19-09-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! In humans, the fertilized egg is implanted into the lining of the uterus. The process of fertilization takes place in the oviduct. After fertilization, the zygote attaches the uterine wall, that is called implantation.
Incorrect. In humans, the fertilized egg is implanted into the lining of the uterus. The process of fertilization takes place in the oviduct. After fertilization, the zygote attaches the uterine wall, that is called implantation.

Q607: Where does the fertilized egg, zygote, implant?

Source: RRB Group-D 17-09-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! See the explanation of above question.
Incorrect. See the explanation of above question.

Q608: Variations that occur during the reproductive process can be –––––––.

Source: RRB Group-D 19-09-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! Variations that occur during the process of reproduction can be inherited. Traits that are transferred from one generation to another, they are called inherited traits. In spite of inheriting traits from parents to children, there are some traits which are completely different from parents, these are called variations.
Incorrect. Variations that occur during the process of reproduction can be inherited. Traits that are transferred from one generation to another, they are called inherited traits. In spite of inheriting traits from parents to children, there are some traits which are completely different from parents, these are called variations.

Q609: Male reproductive cells are produced in ……….

Source: RRB Group-D 17-09-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! Sperm, the male reproductive cells are produced in the testis.
Incorrect. Sperm, the male reproductive cells are produced in the testis.

Q610: Which of the following is a work done by placenta tissue found in humans?

Source: RRB Group-D 17-09-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! The placenta is located in the uterus of women.The placenta is a large organ that develops during pregnancy. It is attached to the wall of the uterus, usually at the top or side. The umbilical cord connects the placenta to embryo. Blood from the mother passes through the placenta, filtering oxygen, glucose and other nutrients to embryo through the umbilical cord. One end of the placenta is attached to the umbilical cord and the other end is connected to the navel of the children.The placenta provides oxygen and nutrients to the uterus while excluding carbon dioxide and other waste matters.
Incorrect. The placenta is located in the uterus of women.The placenta is a large organ that develops during pregnancy. It is attached to the wall of the uterus, usually at the top or side. The umbilical cord connects the placenta to embryo. Blood from the mother passes through the placenta, filtering oxygen, glucose and other nutrients to embryo through the umbilical cord. One end of the placenta is attached to the umbilical cord and the other end is connected to the navel of the children.The placenta provides oxygen and nutrients to the uterus while excluding carbon dioxide and other waste matters.

Q611: Which of the following is not a female reproductive organ?

Source: RRB Group-D 05-12-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! The uterus, ovaries and fallopian tubes are part of the female reproductive system while vas deferens is part of the male reproductive system that connects the male genitals and testicles from both sides.
Incorrect. The uterus, ovaries and fallopian tubes are part of the female reproductive system while vas deferens is part of the male reproductive system that connects the male genitals and testicles from both sides.

Q612: Male and female gametes fuse together to form . . . .

Source: RRB Group-D 07-12-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! During sexual reproduction, a male and female gametes merge together to form a new organism. The two haploid cells fuse together to form a diploid cell called a zygote. The process of coupling of male and female gametes to form zygote is called fertilization. Embryo develop by fertilization.
Incorrect. During sexual reproduction, a male and female gametes merge together to form a new organism. The two haploid cells fuse together to form a diploid cell called a zygote. The process of coupling of male and female gametes to form zygote is called fertilization. Embryo develop by fertilization.

Q613: Which of the following statement is true regarding cleavage?

Source: RRB Group-D 27-11-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! The action of cleavage occurs in zygotes. The term cleavage refers to a series of rapid mitotic division of the zygote following fertilization, celled structure RRB Science Planner Biology YCT 592 forming a many celled blastula. The cleavage follows fertilization and ends with the formation of a 32-celled stage. In cleavage, there is no growth phase. The size of the embryo remains same while size of the daughter cells decreases.The interphase is very little in it. Only DNA is synthesized at the interphase. Cytoplasm of each daughter cells decreases and the blastomeres remain together till the completion of this stage. Consumption of oxygen increases as number of cells increases. Nuclear cytoplasmic ratio increases in cleavage.
Incorrect. The action of cleavage occurs in zygotes. The term cleavage refers to a series of rapid mitotic division of the zygote following fertilization, celled structure RRB Science Planner Biology YCT 592 forming a many celled blastula. The cleavage follows fertilization and ends with the formation of a 32-celled stage. In cleavage, there is no growth phase. The size of the embryo remains same while size of the daughter cells decreases.The interphase is very little in it. Only DNA is synthesized at the interphase. Cytoplasm of each daughter cells decreases and the blastomeres remain together till the completion of this stage. Consumption of oxygen increases as number of cells increases. Nuclear cytoplasmic ratio increases in cleavage.

Q614: The secretion from the prostate gland enters into the:

Source: RRB Group-D 02-11-2018 (Shift-III)
Correct! The prostate gland is found only in men, is a part of male reproductive system. The prostate gland is located around the urethra. The urethra excretes urine from the bladder through the penis.
Incorrect. The prostate gland is found only in men, is a part of male reproductive system. The prostate gland is located around the urethra. The urethra excretes urine from the bladder through the penis.

Q615: ........ changes the appearance seen in boys during puberty:

Source: RRB Group-D 31-10-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! Testosterone is a steroid hormone found mainly in the testicles and adrenal glands of men. High levels of testosterone are related to sexual functionality, reproductive functions, muscular weight, hair growth, excitement and competitive behavior. Testosterone changes the appearance seen in men at the time of puberty. Testosterone levels reaches its peak at the age of 40 and gradually decreases after that.
Incorrect. Testosterone is a steroid hormone found mainly in the testicles and adrenal glands of men. High levels of testosterone are related to sexual functionality, reproductive functions, muscular weight, hair growth, excitement and competitive behavior. Testosterone changes the appearance seen in men at the time of puberty. Testosterone levels reaches its peak at the age of 40 and gradually decreases after that.

Q616: Menstruation is indicated by the bleeding through vagina due to :

Source: RRB Group-D 16-12-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! The ovaries of a girl between 10 and 15 years of age, start producing a developed ovum every month. The egg goes down through fallopian tube that connects the ovary to the uterus. When the egg reaches the uterus, its linings become thick with blood and fluid. This is so that if the egg is fertilized, it can grow and develop its lining for the birth of the baby. If the egg is not fused with male sperm, the uterine lining breaks down into a bloody substance. It then passes down through the cervix and exits through the vagina. This secretion is called menstrual period or menstruation.
Incorrect. The ovaries of a girl between 10 and 15 years of age, start producing a developed ovum every month. The egg goes down through fallopian tube that connects the ovary to the uterus. When the egg reaches the uterus, its linings become thick with blood and fluid. This is so that if the egg is fertilized, it can grow and develop its lining for the birth of the baby. If the egg is not fused with male sperm, the uterine lining breaks down into a bloody substance. It then passes down through the cervix and exits through the vagina. This secretion is called menstrual period or menstruation.

Q617: Fertilized egg, zygote,is implanted in the layer of:

Source: RRB Group-D 30-10-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! Fertilized egg, zygote,is implanted in the layer of Uterus. Successful fusion of male sperm and female egg is called fertilization.
Incorrect. Fertilized egg, zygote,is implanted in the layer of Uterus. Successful fusion of male sperm and female egg is called fertilization.

Q618: Identify the part where the germ cells are formed in the male reproductive organ.

Source: RRB Group-D 30-10-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! The testes in the body are located in a pouch outside the abdominal cavity, called scrotum. The testicle is helpful in lowering the temperature of the testis (2–2.5C), that is necessary for spermatogenesis.
Incorrect. The testes in the body are located in a pouch outside the abdominal cavity, called scrotum. The testicle is helpful in lowering the temperature of the testis (2–2.5C), that is necessary for spermatogenesis.

Q619: Vas deferens is attached to the tube through the bladder to form a common passage, called the –––––––.

Source: RRB Group-D 16-10-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! Vas deferens is attached to the tube through bladder to form a common passage, called Urethra.
Incorrect. Vas deferens is attached to the tube through bladder to form a common passage, called Urethra.

Q620: In some females, due to some problem, fertilization cannot take place. In such cases, freshly released eggs and sperms are kept together for few hours for fertilization to occur outside the body. This is called:

Source: RRB Group-D 08-10-2018 (Shift-II)
Correct! Test tube or In vitro fertilization is an artificial process of fertilization in which eggs (ovum) are extracted from female ovaries and fused with sperm in the test tube. The fertilized egg is then placed in the woman's uterus. Test tube baby develops in the uterus. It is considered the most effective technique of artificial insemination in women. This method is adopted when a woman does not conceive due to some problem.
Incorrect. Test tube or In vitro fertilization is an artificial process of fertilization in which eggs (ovum) are extracted from female ovaries and fused with sperm in the test tube. The fertilized egg is then placed in the woman's uterus. Test tube baby develops in the uterus. It is considered the most effective technique of artificial insemination in women. This method is adopted when a woman does not conceive due to some problem.

Correct! See the explanation of above question.
Incorrect. See the explanation of above question.

Q622: In sexual reproduction, the parents contributes:

Source: RRB Group-D 26-09-2018 (Shift-I)
Correct! The gametes are also called germ cells. They carry only half number of chromosomes/DNA present , compared to somatic cells of an organism.
Incorrect. The gametes are also called germ cells. They carry only half number of chromosomes/DNA present , compared to somatic cells of an organism.

Q623: What is the name of female reproductive cell?

Source: RRB JE 31.05.2019 (Shift-III)
Correct! The female reproductive cell is named Egg.
Incorrect. The female reproductive cell is named Egg.
